title: Top Places to visit in Pratapgarh, Uttar Pradesh
content:
Pratapgarh, also called Belha or Bela Pratapgarh, is a city and municipality of Uttar Pradesh, India. It is the administrative headquarters of Pratapgarh district, part of the Allahabad Division. Pratapgarh is the birthplace of the 'national poet' Harivansh Rai Bachchan.

 

It is one of the oldest districts of Uttar Pradesh, that came into existence in the year 1858. It is at a height of 491m from sea level.

subContents.SubTitle: 1. Shani Dev Temple
subContents.SubContent: Shani Dev Dham, the temple dedicated to Shani Dev, is located at a distance of about 51 km from Allahabad, 16 km from Pratapgarh, 116 km from Ayodhya, & 3 km from Vishwanathganj in Kushfara village. Hanuman and Manokamana temples are also situated in the same premises. Every Saturday people throng in large numbers & perform special worship here. Navratri is also celebrated here

subContents.SubTitle: 2. BELA DEVI
subContents.SubContent: The Bela Devi Temple is one of the important temples situated on the banks of River Sai.. This temple is locally known by the name of “Bela Mai” or mother goddess Bela. Several devotees come from all over India to visit this place and seek the blessings of goddess Bela

subContents.SubTitle: 3. BHAKTI DHAM
subContents.SubContent:
Bhakti Mandir is a Hindu Temple located in tehsil Kunda district Pratapgarh.This divine temple was established by the world’s fifth original Jagadguru in November 2005. It is maintained by  Kripalu Parishat, a non-profit, charitable, educational and spiritual organisation.

 

Beautiful life sized Divine Deities of Radha Krishna (on the ground floor) and Sita Ram (on the first floor) leave the visitors spell bound. Adjacent to it is a large dome which is another magnificent structure.

subContents.SubTitle: 4. Ghusmeshwar Nath Dham
subContents.SubContent: Ghusmeshwar Nath Dham is believed to be the holiest site of pilgrimage of this region. It is located on the bank of River Sai and enshrines a Shiva Linga, which is popular here by the name of Baba Ghuisarnath Dham.

subContents.SubTitle: 5. Baba Bhayaharan Nath Dham
subContents.SubContent:
Baba Bhayaharan Nath Dham is an ancient Shiva temple, situated in the village of Katra Gulab Singh, on the banks of Bakulahi River. The temple enshrines a Shiva Linga and it is believed that this Shiva Linga was set up by the Pandavas at this place. As per legends, the Shiva Linga of Bhayaharan Nath was established by Bhima, after killing the demon Bakasur. Saints Shri Naga Baba and Shri Dandi Baba stayed at this place, worshipped Shiva and served this temple for many years.

source: https://pratapgarh.nic.in/tourist-places/

subContents.SubTitle: 6. How to Reach
subContents.SubContent:
By Road:

You can reach Pratapgarh by UPSRTC Transport government bus service from various city.Like Allahabad to Pratapgarh distance is around 62 km (approx 2 hrs by road).Lucknow to Pratapgarh distance is around 190 km (approx 4 hrs by road).Sultanpur to Pratapgarh distance is around 40 km (approx 1 hrs by road).

 

By Train:

You can also reach here by train.The nearest Railway station is Pratapgarh Junction. There are various trains facilities available for coming to district Pratapgarh.

 

By Air

The nearest airport from Pratapgarh district is situated in Luknow.

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Moradabad, Uttar Pradesh
recommendations.content:
Moradabad is a city, commissionary, and a municipal corporation in Moradabad district of Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. It was established in 1625 A.D. by Rustam Khan and is named after prince Murad Baksh, the youngest son of the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan and Empress Mumtaz Mahal.

recommendations.content: Etah is a municipality town which is also the district headquarters of Etah district of Uttar Pradesh state, India. recommendations.content: Bulandshahr is a city and a municipal board in Bulandshahr district in the state of Uttar Pradesh, India. It is the administrative headquarters of Bulandshahr District. recommendations.title: Top Places to Visit in Varanasi with family.
recommendations.content: Varanasi, also known as Benares, Banaras, or Kashi, is a city on the banks of the Ganges in the Uttar Pradesh state of North India, 320 kilometres (200 mi) south-east of the state capital, Lucknow, and 121 kilometres (75 mi) east of Allahabad.
